explanation: - add_response_entry_n: The callee could be a macro or inline construct that expands into code which assigns to or otherwise modifies the local parameter variables (response, kind, header, content). To decide whether the target function itself modifies any of its parameters we must inspect the definition/expansion of add_response_entry_n.\n- strlen: Although normally a library function, strlen might be a macro or inline implementation in this code base. A macro/inline could contain side effects that assign to its argument (e.g. header), which would constitute modification of a parameter variable inside this function. Inspecting the strlen definition rules that out.\n- MHD_YES / MHD_NO: These identifiers may be macros (not just enum constants). If they are function-like or have side effects when expanded, they could indirectly cause modification of parameters in the return expression. Verifying their definitions ensures the ternary expression does not alter any parameter variable.
